title: How I Turned Spare Change Into My First Investment
author: Lindiwe M.
excerpt: What started with just R10 a week taught me the power of patience and planning.
content:
It began with coins I used to forget in my bag. I started putting R10 aside each week. That tiny habit built my confidence and eventually my first investment.

Step 1: Automate a small amount

Small, consistent steps beat huge, rare efforts.
keyTakeaway: Start tiny and be consistent — small contributions accumulate into meaningful investments.

title: A 30-Day Saving Challenge That Actually Worked
author: James O.
excerpt: Simple daily choices added up to an emergency cushion and a calmer month.
content:
I committed to saving a small, fixed amount every day and reduced impulse buys. By day 30 I had a small buffer and a new habit.

  • Automate transfers
  • Track spending
  • Reward milestones
keyTakeaway: Micro-savings build confidence. Treat saving like a habit, not a punishment.

title: Budgeting Without Gaslighting Yourself
author: Nneka A.
excerpt: A compassionate, realistic approach to budgets that actually last.
content:
Budgets fail when they ignore life. I learned to design a budget that reflects real spending and still moves me forward.

Be honest with your money, not mean to it.
keyTakeaway: Design a budget that fits your life — small wins keep you going.

title: How Maria Paid Off Debt and Kept Her Curiosity
author: Amara F.
excerpt: Maria combined steady payments and learning to turn debt into breathing room.
content: Maria began with one simple rule: pay something every week. She also learned to ask better questions about money instead of avoiding them.
keyTakeaway: Consistent action and curiosity beat guilt — small payments + learning creates momentum.

title: Beginner's Guide: First Steps Into Investing
author: David K.
excerpt: A gentle path to your first investment without jargon or pressure.
content:
Investing doesn't need to be mysterious. Start with learning, then a small, simple allocation.

3 starter steps

  1. Build a small emergency buffer
  2. Learn about one asset class
  3. Open an account and invest a tiny amount
keyTakeaway: Learn first, invest small, and iterate — clarity beats haste.

title: Community Corner: How We Hosted Our First Money Lab
author: Cognition Berries
excerpt: A short look at our first live lab where learners practiced budgeting together.
content: We ran a one-hour practice lab. People left with a plan and a connection. Community helps learning stick.
keyTakeaway: Learning with others makes small lessons feel possible.
